top_comments.comment: If you say "Mahler" and "underrated" you're automatically talking about his 7th

Thank you so much, Brett and Eddy, to create this amazing list, many of the pieces in it was still unknown for me before I watch this video. 
Anyways, I have had a list of pieces which I hope more people should know about before I watch this. Here is the list: 
1. Ravel - Introduction et Allegro pour Harp, Flûte, Clarinette et Quatuor à Cordes
2. Ravel - 3 Poèmes de Stéphane Mallarmé
3. Ravel - La Valse
4. Ravel - Piano Trio
5. Brahms - Piano Quintet 
6. Brahms - Piano Sonata no. 3
7. Rachmaninoff - Cello Sonata
8. Scriabin - Piano Sonata no. 5
9. Scriabin - Prelude no. 1
10. Debussy - Estampes
What do you guys think abt this list???
fun fact about prokotiev my mothers cousin married his son

My recomendation is Camille Saint-Saëns - Fantaisie for violin and harp Op. 124
It's beautiful

What an epic video! Just from the snippets included in this video, I’m already loving how these pieces sound like - can’t wait to add them to my playlist and savour them! Thank you Twoset for the recommendations❤️!

comments_since_last_sample.body: Hey guys! Charming and fun and learning a lot, thanks!! Now. Time to work on your French pronunciation!
If you say "Mahler" and "underrated" you're automatically talking about his 7th
So happy to see Kapustin recognized!!! Wonderful job, guys, this is an awesone video
I've loved that Sibelius piece ever since I heard some girl play it during a high school graduation ceremony. Glad to see it get some recognition!
I will have to find the entire Third Concerto of Prokoviev by Yuja Wang.  What a performance.

Waw Le sapin by Sibelius, it's so good ! I didn't know this piece. You said it didn't seems too hard. I think maybe the notes are not, but the dynamics of this guy are soooo good and I think it's so hard to have this result

Here are some of mine:

Glazunov - Petit Adagio
D'Indy - Symphony on a French Mountain Air
Bizet - L'Arlesienne Adagietto
Rimsky-Korsakov - Symphony No. 3
DeFalla - Nights in the Gardens of Spain

Would have put Danse Sacree and Profane on there, but Brett and Eddy stole it 😁

You guys should do a follow up with 10 more pieces!

What an epic video! Just from the snippets included in this video, I’m already loving how these pieces sound like - can’t wait to add them to my playlist and savour them! Thank you Twoset for the recommendations❤️!
Love this type of video! Also would be great if you could put in the description the names all the classical pieces you play in the background of your videos, helps discover so much more stuff!

I already knew which composers this would mostly be without watching or looking at the description. Sorry, guys, but you will never make me like any impressionistic music, ever. Or Mahler. Okay to the rest.

My recomendation is Camille Saint-Saëns - Fantaisie for violin and harp Op. 124
It's beautiful
